etymology.description: Depicts a sprouting seed or still-growing plant, symbolizing young talent or a beginning
etymology.interpretation: The character 才(才) (cái, "talent") represents a young plant or seedling sprouting from the ground, capturing the idea of potential or beginning which aligns with its meaning related to talent or developing ability.

examples.chinese: 完成作业后(完成作業後)，他才开始玩耍(他才開始玩耍)。
examples.pinyin: Wánchéng zuòyè hòu, tā cái kāishǐ wánshuǎ.
examples.english: Only after finishing his homework did he begin to play.

examples.chinese: 这个年轻人有优秀的才(這個年輕人有優秀的才)，令人惊叹(令人驚嘆)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège niánqīngrén yǒu yōuxiù de cái, lìng rén jīngtàn.
examples.english: This young person has outstanding talent, which amazes people.
